intro: Cabreriella sanctae-martae, commonly known as the sacred mountain tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its rarity and ecological significance, it is considered a valuable species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
